In addition to the distance numbers being much closer to the middle, the aiming lines are a bit wider and thicker to make them easier to see. The rangefinding number has been brought a bit lower. Altogether, these modifications should make it easier and faster to aim in RB and SB.

#customsight #sight #t29 #fictional #semi_fictional

This package contains three sights for the T29, ranging from a sight possibly close to the real thing, to the same sight with additional features like stadimetric rangefinder and funnel and deflection aiming help for moving targets

The sight also features a pattern as historically used by the US Army in WW2, with horizontal MILS scale (gap and line length 5 mils each). For the "light" version, I just added ranging scales for all ammo types as a concession to playability. The "medium" variant

This is an entirely fictional sight for the Begleitpanzer 57. I based the center sight on the post war sight of the Leo 1 from RideR2's Pack (found here https://live.warthunder.com/post/675135/en/) And followed the general style of the Leo A1A1 sight found in the same pack. Has range scales for AP-T and MG3, along with a circle that remains at the default zero of the sight so you're able to use it to aim ATGMs if you've changed zero. For style, I also added corners to roughly where the max zoom is, because it looks nice :P

Can be seen in action here; https://streamable.com/ysmwp

Schindibee's Sight for M4A3 (105) HVSS Sherman

#customsight #sight #sherman #m4a3_105 #semifictional

This package contains sights for the 105mm howitzer armed M4A3 Sherman.

The sight features primary aiming scale, ranging funnel (for tank length of 7m / width of 3.5m) and deflection aiming cues (for moving targets, 20km/ and 40km/h) for the HEAT ammo, secondary aiming scales for HE and Smoke ammo and coaxial machine gun.

The sight also features a pattern as historically used by the US Army in WW2, with horizontal MILS scale (gap and line length 5 mils each).
